title: Resource for type samples
content:
I was wondering if anyone knew of a website where I can find examples of different styles of type set on, say, a newspaper or poster. Something like The Book Cover Archive but for a wider range of media.

Just thought I'd give it a go. Thanks for any response you can provide.
author: NathanNearing

comments.content:
There's a great book by Tamye Riggs, called [Typeface: Classic Typography for Contemporary Design](http://web.archive.org/), which shows many classic fonts "in action".

No disrespect to Typophile, but when I want to bombard myself with type in action, I go to the "What The Font" forum over at myfonts.com. It's only logos, but that is a great way to see random fonts in action.

I keep [an archive of fonts in use](http://web.archive.org/web/20100131075711/http:/delicious.com/stewf/bundle:Fonts%20In%20Use) on my Delicious account. I post my favorite examples on [Type Tide](http://web.archive.org/web/20100131075711/http:/typetide.tumblr.com/).
Stephen... fantastic site! I just added you to my blogroll.
I love WLT but there is more lettering there than type.
